subtitle_list.designation: Master of Science in Computer Science

Projects.title: CodeJudge - Competitive Programming Platform
Projects.content_head: In this project, we built a Competitive Programming Platform. It is a Ruby on Rails-based web application, deployed using Docker and Heroku. Instructors can create problems, and students can solve them in their preferred programming language. The platform offers real-time code evaluation, a leaderboard for healthy competition, and a collaborative discussion forum. With automated test case evaluation and analytics, it fosters an engaging and supportive learning environment for students aspiring to excel in data structures and algorithms.

Projects.title: Fast image classification using ResNet variant
Projects.content_head: In this project, I have created an advanced image classification model that harnesses the potential of ResNet in conjunction with shortcut networks, achieving exceptional precision and efficiency during training. The introduction of a novel ResNet variant, carefully optimized in terms of layer depth, channel sizes, and skip connections, strikes an ideal balance between complexity and performance. The model showcased remarkable results, attaining an impressive accuracy of 93.56% within just 90 epochs over the CIFAR-10 dataset, a testament to its strategic approach in overcoming challenges like vanishing gradients and slow convergence.

Projects.title: A novel graph clustering method
Projects.content_head: In this paper, we introduce a novel k-way graph conductance function to measure the quality of a k-clustering on a graph. We compare its effectiveness in finding k-clusters to existing k-way conductance functions and give a novel proof for a k-way Cheegerâ€™s inequality on this conductance function.

Professional Experience.content_head: Worked in the Search Engineering team on a natural language, petabyte-scale, distributed search engine that powers search for almost every use-case of the firm. Major contributions to the product were:
content_items: Improved the complexity of the retrieval algorithm, reducing the average retrieval latency by a factor of 50.
Improved the detection of meaningful n-grams in search queries, increasing precision from 0.45 to 0.85 and recall from 0.30 to 0.59.
Redesigned the document scoring algorithm, improving query-document relevance by 30%.
Introduced a score to consider the positions of relevant terms in documents, further improving query-document relevance by 16%.
Worked on summarizing search results (which could go up to a billion documents).
Generated the inverted index for two corpora.

Professional Experience.content_head: Engaged in a vision-oriented project encompassing image segmentation and classification, I developed a comprehensive application capable of capturing images from a camera and saving them either locally or on Azure. The application offers a user-friendly interface to label the captured images and utilizes well-known models like ResNet, AlexNet, GoogLeNet, among others, for training on the annotated data. After training, these models can be easily deployed from the UI. To create the web interface, I employed NodeJS and libraries such as React, while PyTorch was utilized for crafting the deep learning models.

Developed a versatile scheduler designed to handle a diverse range of batch-processing map-reduce jobs. Achieved automation and monitoring capabilities for extensive workloads, encapsulating the entire process within a well-structured and efficient program.  Honed my skills in software development, automation, and gained valuable insights into large-scale data processing systems.

Academic Experience.title_left: Data Integration, Visualization, and Exploration Lab
Academic Experience.content_head: As an open source contributor to DIVE Lab's deep learning Python library, "DIVE into Graphs" (DIG), I focused on leveraging my expertise in PyTorch, PyTorch Geometric, and Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) to enhance the library's capabilities. My contributions to the project included the following:
content_items: Implemented the GraphAug method based on the paper "Automated Data Augmentations for Graph Classification", using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) for graph datasets.
Created user-friendly Python documentation for the GraphAug implementation.
Improved graph classification performance by generating label-invariant augmentations.

Academic Experience.content_head: Led lectures on Data Structures and Algorithms and organized on-campus coding contests - Insomnia, CodeBlitz, and CodeCipher. Fostering a culture of learning and competition, I contributed to the group's growth and facilitated students' development in programming and problem-solving. Strong leadership and organizational skills ensured successful events and a supportive community.

subtitle_list.designation: Represented IIT @ ACM-ICPC India on-site regionals
All India Rank 502 out of 1.2 million candidates
